=====================

### Tender Notice: EW479-162880 - Collection, Transportation and Disposal of Biowaste

#### Government Agency
Santé Canada (Health Canada)
200 Eglantine Driveway, Ottawa, Ontario, K1A 0K9, Canada

#### Call for Tender
A competitive solicitation against a supply arrangement (RFP) has been announced by Health Canada for the collection, transportation, and disposal of hazardous materials, including biomedical waste.

#### Tender Description
Santé Canada operates a laboratory in the Longueuil area, generating hazardous materials and biomedical waste under federal, provincial, and municipal regulations. The incumbent must ensure compliance with all current and proposed legislation regarding the tracking, generation, packaging, collection, transportation, disposal, and incineration of hazardous waste materials.

#### Objective
The successful contractor must provide services for the collection, tracking, transportation, and disposal of hazardous materials, including chemical and biomedical waste, to handling sites meeting the requirements for secure landfills.

#### Eligibility Criteria
Respondents must demonstrate expertise in providing safe and efficient disposed of biomedical waste, adhere to environmental and health regulations, and have experience working with:
* Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques de la Faune et des parcs du Québec
* Environment and Climate Change Canada
* Transport Canada

#### Contact Information

* Shallee Doll, Contract Officer
* Email: [shallee.doll@hc-sc.gc.ca](mailto:shallee.doll@hc-sc.gc.ca)
* Phone: (000) 000-0000

#### Tender Documents and Requirements
Please refer to the attached tender documents for complete details on the requirements and specifications.

#### Handling, Transportation, and Disposal Locations
Health Canada would require that biomedical waste be transported and disposed of in accordance with the following:
* Ministère de l’Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques de la Faune et des parcs du Québec ( Regulation respecting the control of activities based on their impact on the environment (REAFIE).
* 2004-26-other national and international requirements specific to biomedical waste.
